steps.title: Acknowledge the Journey
steps.voiceCue: Take a deep breath. Acknowledge where you are today and the brave step you're taking towards healing. You've got this.

steps.title: Focus on Small Wins
steps.voiceCue: Every gentle movement, every moment of self-care is a victory. Celebrate these small steps towards your goal.

steps.title: Visualize Your Recovery
steps.voiceCue: Close your eyes and imagine your knee moving freely, pain-free. Feel the strength returning with each breath. Envision full mobility.

steps.title: Heel Slides (Supine)
steps.voiceCue: Lie on your back, slowly slide your heel towards your glute, bending your knee gently. Go only as far as comfortable. Perform 10 repetitions per leg, smooth and controlled.

steps.title: Quadriceps Sets
steps.voiceCue: Lie or sit with your leg straight. Press the back of your knee into the surface, tightening your thigh muscle. Hold for 5 seconds, then release. Complete 10 repetitions, focusing on muscle activation.

steps.title: Gentle Knee Extensions (Seated)
steps.voiceCue: Sit on a chair, slowly straighten your leg using your thigh muscle. Do not lock your knee at the top. Lower slowly with control. Perform 10 repetitions per leg.

steps.title: Ankle Pumps
steps.voiceCue: Lie down, gently pump your ankles up and down, pointing and flexing your foot. This helps improve circulation. Complete 15-20 repetitions, keeping movements fluid.

steps.title: Reflect on Day 1
steps.voiceCue: Take a moment to acknowledge your commitment from yesterday. You showed up for yourself, and that's powerful.

steps.title: Celebrate Your Effort
steps.voiceCue: Every consistent step builds momentum. Be proud of the effort you're putting into your healing. Your dedication is key.

steps.title: Reinforce Daily Commitment
steps.voiceCue: Today is another opportunity. Remember why you started and commit to this present moment of healing and growth.

steps.title: Glute Squeezes (Supine)
steps.voiceCue: Lie on your back, knees bent, feet flat. Gently squeeze your glutes together, hold for 3-5 seconds, then relax. Complete 10-12 repetitions, feeling the activation.

steps.title: Straight Leg Raises (Supine)
steps.voiceCue: Lie on your back, one knee bent, the other straight. Keeping the straight leg active, lift it a few inches off the floor, hold briefly, then slowly lower. Perform 8-10 repetitions per leg.

steps.title: Gentle Clam Shells (Side-Lying)
steps.voiceCue: Lie on your side, knees bent, feet together. Keeping your feet touching, slowly open your top knee like a clam shell. Only go as far as comfortable. Do 10 repetitions per side.

steps.title: Pelvic Tilts
steps.voiceCue: Lie on your back, knees bent. Gently flatten your lower back into the floor by tightening your abdominal muscles. Hold for a few seconds, then release. Complete 10 repetitions.

steps.title: Acknowledge Your Progress
steps.voiceCue: Pause and appreciate how far you've come, even in these three days. Your body is resilient and responds to your care.

steps.title: Visualize Greater Mobility
steps.voiceCue: Imagine yourself walking, climbing stairs, or engaging in activities you enjoy, with ease and comfort. See it, feel it.

steps.title: Plan for Continued Recovery
steps.voiceCue: This routine is a stepping stone. Consider how you'll continue nurturing your knee and body beyond these three days.

steps.title: Seated Knee Flexion/Extension (Active Assist)
steps.voiceCue: Sit on a chair, gently bend and straighten your knee. You can use your hands to assist the movement if needed, guiding it gently. Perform 8-10 repetitions per leg, focusing on smooth motion.

steps.title: Wall Slides / Mini Squats (Supported)
steps.voiceCue: Stand with your back against a wall, feet shoulder-width apart. Slowly slide down into a mini squat, only a few inches, feeling your thigh muscles. Push back up. Complete 8-10 repetitions, using the wall for support.

steps.title: Seated Heel Raises
steps.voiceCue: Sit on a chair, feet flat. Lift your heels off the floor, keeping the balls of your feet down. Hold briefly, then lower. Perform 12-15 repetitions, feeling your calf muscles.

steps.title: Gentle Hamstring Stretch (Seated/Supine)
steps.voiceCue: Sit or lie down. Gently extend one leg forward, keeping the knee soft, and lean slightly forward (seated) or use a towel to gently pull the leg up (supine). Hold 20-30 seconds. Perform 1 repetition per leg, feeling a gentle stretch.
